abstract: Ford outsold G.M. in March, as auto sales increased across the industry, despite worries about rising gasoline prices and production stoppages in Japan.
snippet: Ford outsold G.M. in March, as auto sales increased across the industry, despite worries about rising gasoline prices and production stoppages in Japan.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Ford Motor outsold General Motors in the United States last month for only the second time since 1998, and overall new-vehicle sales increased 17 percent despite concerns about high gasoline prices and production stoppages in Japan.

headline.main: Ford Tops G.M. as Auto Sales Rise for All but Toyota
headline.print_headline: Ford Tops G.M. as Auto Sales Rise for All but Toyota
